Calculate Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)

Source: R/calculations.R
calculate_egfr.Rd

Calculate Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) for adults

calculate_egfr(scr, age, sexf, racen)

Arguments

scr

Serum Creatinine (mg/dL). Numeric vector.

age

Age (y). Numeric vector.

sexf

Sex. Numeric vector including values of 0 and/or 1. 0=Male; 1=Female.

racen

Race. Numeric vector where the value 2 is expected to correspond to Black/African American.

Value

This function returns a numeric vector the same length as its inputs

Details

Formula to calculate EGFR: 
  EGFR [mL/min/1.73m^2] = 175 × (SCR [mg/dL] ^ -1.154) × (AGE [y] ^ -0.203) × (0.742 if female) × (1.212 if African American)

References

Guidance for Industry: Pharmacokinetics in Patients with Impaired Renal Function — Study Design, Data Analysis, and Impact on Dosing and Labeling

See also

calculate_egfr_child

Examples

library(dplyr)

dmcognigen_cov %>% 
  mutate(EGFR = calculate_egfr(
    scr = SCR, 
    age = AGE, 
    sexf = SEXF, 
    racen = RACEN
  ))
#> Formula to calculate EGFR: 
#>   EGFR [mL/min/1.73m^2] = 175 × (SCR [mg/dL] ^ -1.154) × (AGE [y] ^ -0.203) × (0.742 if female) × (1.212 if African American)

# Below will also work if the dataset contains expected variables
dmcognigen_cov %>% 
  mutate(EGFR = calculate_egfr())
#> SCR variable found and used for the scr argument.
#> AGE variable found and used for the age argument.
